verses.verse: I <WH589> am the man <WH1397> that hath seen <WH7200> affliction <WH6040> by the rod <WH7626> of his wrath. <WH5678>
He hath led <WH5090> me, and brought <WH1980> me into darkness, <WH2822> but not <WH3808> into light. <WH216>
Surely <WH389> against me is he turned; <WH7725> he turneth <WH2015> his hand <WH3027> against me all <WH3605> the day. <WH3117>
My flesh <WH1320> and my skin <WH5785> hath he made old; <WH1086> he hath broken <WH7665> my bones. <WH6106>
He hath built <WH1129> against <WH5921> me, and compassed <WH5362> me with gall <WH7219> and travail. <WH8513>
He hath set <WH3427> me in dark places, <WH4285> as they that be dead <WH4191> of old. <WH5769>
He hath hedged <WH1443> me about, <WH1157> that I cannot <WH3808> get out: <WH3318> he hath made my chain heavy. <WH3513> <WH5178>
Also <WH1571> when <WH3588> I cry <WH2199> and shout, <WH7768> he shutteth out <WH5640> my prayer. <WH8605>
He hath enclosed <WH1443> my ways <WH1870> with hewn stone, <WH1496> he hath made my paths crooked. <WH5753> <WH5410>
He <WH1931> was unto me as a bear <WH1677> lying in wait, <WH693> and as a lion <WH738> in secret places. <WH4565>
He hath turned aside <WH5493> my ways, <WH1870> and pulled me in pieces: <WH6582> he hath made <WH7760> me desolate. <WH8074>
He hath bent <WH1869> his bow, <WH7198> and set <WH5324> me as a mark <WH4307> for the arrow. <WH2671>
He hath caused the arrows <WH1121> of his quiver <WH827> to enter <WH935> into my reins. <WH3629>
I was <WH1961> a derision <WH7814> to all <WH3605> my people; <WH5971> and their song <WH5058> all <WH3605> the day. <WH3117>
He hath filled <WH7646> me with bitterness, <WH4844> he hath made me drunken <WH7301> with wormwood. <WH3939>
He hath also broken <WH1638> my teeth <WH8127> with gravel stones, <WH2687> he hath covered <WH3728> me with ashes. <WH665>
And thou hast removed my soul far off <WH2186> <WH5315> from peace: <WH4480> <WH7965> I forgot <WH5382> prosperity. <WH2896>
And I said, <WH559> My strength <WH5331> and my hope <WH8431> is perished <WH6> from the LORD: <WH4480> <WH3068>
Remembering <WH2142> mine affliction <WH6040> and my misery, <WH4788> the wormwood <WH3939> and the gall. <WH7219>
My soul <WH5315> hath them still in remembrance, <WH2142> <WH2142> and is humbled <WH7743> in <WH5921> me.
This <WH2063> I recall <WH7725> to <WH413> my mind, <WH3820> therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> have I hope. <WH3176>
It is of the LORD's <WH3068> mercies <WH2617> that <WH3588> we are not <WH3808> consumed, <WH8552> because <WH3588> his compassions <WH7356> fail <WH3615> not. <WH3808>
They are new <WH2319> every morning: <WH1242> great <WH7227> is thy faithfulness. <WH530>
The LORD <WH3068> is my portion, <WH2506> saith <WH559> my soul; <WH5315> therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> will I hope <WH3176> in him.
The LORD <WH3068> is good <WH2896> unto them that wait for <WH6960> him, to the soul <WH5315> that seeketh <WH1875> him.
It is good <WH2896> that a man should both hope <WH3175> and quietly wait <WH1748> for the salvation <WH8668> of the LORD. <WH3068>
It is good <WH2896> for a man <WH1397> that <WH3588> he bear <WH5375> the yoke <WH5923> in his youth. <WH5271>
He sitteth <WH3427> alone <WH910> and keepeth silence, <WH1826> because <WH3588> he hath borne <WH5190> it upon <WH5921> him.
He putteth <WH5414> his mouth <WH6310> in the dust; <WH6083> if so be <WH194> there may be <WH3426> hope. <WH8615>
He giveth <WH5414> his cheek <WH3895> to him that smiteth <WH5221> him: he is filled full <WH7646> with reproach. <WH2781>
For <WH3588> the Lord <WH136> will not <WH3808> cast off <WH2186> forever: <WH5769>
But <WH3588> though <WH518> he cause grief, <WH3013> yet will he have compassion <WH7355> according to the multitude <WH7230> of his mercies. <WH2617>
For <WH3588> he doth not <WH3808> afflict <WH6031> willingly <WH4480> <WH3820> nor grieve <WH3013> the children <WH1121> of men. <WH376>
To crush <WH1792> under <WH8478> his feet <WH7272> all <WH3605> the prisoners <WH615> of the earth, <WH776>
To turn aside <WH5186> the right <WH4941> of a man <WH1397> before <WH5048> the face <WH6440> of the most High, <WH5945>
To subvert <WH5791> a man <WH120> in his cause, <WH7379> the Lord <WH136> approveth <WH7200> not. <WH3808>
Who <WH4310> is he <WH2088> that saith, <WH559> and it cometh to pass, <WH1961> when the Lord <WH136> commandeth <WH6680> it not? <WH3808>
Out of the mouth <WH4480> <WH6310> of the most High <WH5945> proceedeth <WH3318> not <WH3808> evil <WH7451> and good? <WH2896>
Wherefore <WH4100> doth a living <WH2416> man <WH120> complain, <WH596> a man <WH1397> for <WH5921> the punishment of his sins? <WH2399>
Let us search <WH2664> and try <WH2713> our ways, <WH1870> and turn again <WH7725> to <WH5704> the LORD. <WH3068>
Let us lift up <WH5375> our heart <WH3824> with <WH413> our hands <WH3709> unto <WH413> God <WH410> in the heavens. <WH8064>
We <WH5168> have transgressed <WH6586> and have rebelled: <WH4784> thou <WH859> hast not <WH3808> pardoned. <WH5545>
Thou hast covered <WH5526> with anger, <WH639> and persecuted <WH7291> us: thou hast slain, <WH2026> thou hast not <WH3808> pitied. <WH2550>
Thou hast covered <WH5526> thyself with a cloud, <WH6051> that our prayer <WH8605> should not pass through. <WH4480> <WH5674>
Thou hast made <WH7760> us as the offscouring <WH5501> and refuse <WH3973> in the midst <WH7130> of the people. <WH5971>
All <WH3605> our enemies <WH341> have opened <WH6475> their mouths <WH6310> against <WH5921> us.
Fear <WH6343> and a snare <WH6354> is come <WH1961> upon us, desolation <WH7612> and destruction. <WH7667>
Mine eye <WH5869> runneth down <WH3381> with rivers <WH6388> of water <WH4325> for <WH5921> the destruction <WH7667> of the daughter <WH1323> of my people. <WH5971>
Mine eye <WH5869> trickleth down, <WH5064> and ceaseth <WH1820> not, <WH3808> without any <WH4480> <WH369> intermission, <WH2014>
Till <WH5704> the LORD <WH3068> look down, <WH8259> and behold <WH7200> from heaven. <WH4480> <WH8064>
Mine eye <WH5869> affecteth <WH5953> mine heart <WH5315> because of all <WH4480> <WH3605> the daughters <WH1323> of my city. <WH5892>
Mine enemies <WH341> chased me sore, <WH6679> <WH6679> like a bird, <WH6833> without cause. <WH2600>
They have cut off <WH6789> my life <WH2416> in the dungeon, <WH953> and cast <WH3034> a stone <WH68> upon me.
Waters <WH4325> flowed <WH6687> over <WH5921> mine head; <WH7218> then I said, <WH559> I am cut off. <WH1504>
I called upon <WH7121> thy name, <WH8034> O LORD, <WH3068> out of the low dungeon. <WH4480> <WH953> <WH8482>
Thou hast heard <WH8085> my voice: <WH6963> hide <WH5956> not <WH408> thine ear <WH241> at my breathing, <WH7309> at my cry. <WH7775>
Thou drewest near <WH7126> in the day <WH3117> that I called upon <WH7121> thee: thou saidst, <WH559> Fear <WH3372> not. <WH408>
O Lord, <WH136> thou hast pleaded <WH7378> the causes <WH7379> of my soul; <WH5315> thou hast redeemed <WH1350> my life. <WH2416>
O LORD, <WH3068> thou hast seen <WH7200> my wrong: <WH5792> judge <WH8199> thou my cause. <WH4941>
Thou hast seen <WH7200> all <WH3605> their vengeance <WH5360> and all <WH3605> their imaginations <WH4284> against me.
Thou hast heard <WH8085> their reproach, <WH2781> O LORD, <WH3068> and all <WH3605> their imaginations <WH4284> against <WH5921> me;
The lips <WH8193> of those that rose up against <WH6965> me, and their device <WH1902> against <WH5921> me all <WH3605> the day. <WH3117>
Behold <WH5027> their sitting down, <WH3427> and their rising up; <WH7012> I <WH589> am their music. <WH4485>
Render <WH7725> unto them a recompense, <WH1576> O LORD, <WH3068> according to the work <WH4639> of their hands. <WH3027>
Give <WH5414> them sorrow <WH4044> of heart, <WH3820> thy curse <WH8381> unto them.
Persecute <WH7291> and destroy <WH8045> them in anger <WH639> from under <WH4480> <WH8478> the heavens <WH8064> of the LORD. <WH3068>
